items.title: Frequently Asked Questions
items.text:
What is docwalk?

Your codebase, documented. Automatically. Analyze any repo, generate MkDocs Material sites, deploy anywhere, and keep docs in sync with git-diff intelligence.

What languages/technologies does docwalk use?

typescript (100%).

What commands are available?

Available commands: docwalk ci-setup, docwalk deploy, docwalk dev, docwalk doctor, docwalk generate, docwalk init, docwalk status, docwalk sync, docwalk undeploy, docwalk version-list, docwalk version-deploy. See the Getting Started guide for usage details.

Where can I find the developer documentation?

See the Developer Reference section for architecture, API reference, and source documentation.

Generated by DocWalk

items.title: Features
items.text: A comprehensive guide to everything docwalk can do.

items.title: docwalk ci-setup
items.text: Generates provider-specific CI/CD pipeline configuration. Supports both production deploy and PR preview workflows.

items.title: docwalk deploy
items.text: Orchestrates: build → provider auth check → deploy → domain setup. Provides user-friendly errors when external tools are missing.

items.title: docwalk dev
items.text: Starts Zensical dev server for local preview. If Zensical isn't installed, auto-installs it into .docwalk/venv/ (no system pip needed).

items.title: docwalk doctor
items.text: Checks prerequisites and installs Zensical into a managed venv at .docwalk/venv/ — no system-wide pip install needed.

items.title: docwalk generate
items.text: Runs the full analysis → generation pipeline: 1. Load config (auto-init if missing) 2. Analyze codebase (with ora spinners) 3. Generate MkDocs Material site

items.title: docwalk init
items.text: Interactive setup wizard with two tracks: Quick Start — 3 steps: confirm repo, AI setup, theme → generate Custom — Full 6-step wizard (repo, analysis, deploy, domain, sync, theme)

items.title: docwalk status
items.text: Shows current sync state, project info, and config summary.

items.title: docwalk sync
items.text: Runs incremental sync: git-diff → targeted re-analysis → rebuild.

items.title: docwalk undeploy
items.text: Removes a deployed documentation site from the hosting provider.

items.title: docwalk version-list
items.text: List available versions from git tags matching the configured pattern.

items.title: docwalk version-deploy
items.text:
Deploy a specific version tag using mike.

Options:

  • --tag

Generated by DocWalk

items.title: Getting Started
items.text: This guide will help you install and start using docwalk.

items.title: Installation
items.text: npm install

items.title: Quick Start
items.text:
After installation, you can use the following commands:

Command Description docwalk ci-setup Generates provider-specific CI/CD pipeline configuration. Supports both production deploy and PR preview workflows. docwalk deploy Orchestrates: build → provider auth check → deploy → domain setup. Provides user-friendly errors when external tools are missing. docwalk dev Starts Zensical dev server for local preview. If Zensical isn't installed, auto-installs it into .docwalk/venv/ (no system pip needed). docwalk doctor Checks prerequisites and installs Zensical into a managed venv at .docwalk/venv/ — no system-wide pip install needed. docwalk generate Runs the full analysis → generation pipeline: 1. Load config (auto-init if missing) 2. Analyze codebase (with ora spinners) 3. Generate MkDocs Material site docwalk init Interactive setup wizard with two tracks: Quick Start — 3 steps: confirm repo, AI setup, theme → generate Custom — Full 6-step wizard (repo, analysis, deploy, domain, sync, theme) docwalk status Shows current sync state, project info, and config summary. docwalk sync Runs incremental sync: git-diff → targeted re-analysis → rebuild. docwalk undeploy Removes a deployed documentation site from the hosting provider. docwalk version-list List available versions from git tags matching the configured pattern.

items.title: docwalk
items.text: Your codebase, documented. Automatically. Analyze any repo, generate MkDocs Material sites, deploy anywhere, and keep docs in sync with git-diff intelligence.

items.title: Commands
items.text:
docwalk provides the following commands:

  • ci-setup — Generates provider-specific CI/CD pipeline configuration. Supports both production deploy and PR preview workflows.
  • deploy — Orchestrates: build → provider auth check → deploy → domain setup. Provides user-friendly errors when external tools are missing.
  • dev — Starts Zensical dev server for local preview. If Zensical isn't installed, auto-installs it into .docwalk/venv/ (no system pip needed).
  • doctor — Checks prerequisites and installs Zensical into a managed venv at .docwalk/venv/ — no system-wide pip install needed.
  • generate — Runs the full analysis → generation pipeline: 1. Load config (auto-init if missing) 2. Analyze codebase (with ora spinners) 3. Generate MkDocs Material site
  • init — Interactive setup wizard with two tracks: Quick Start — 3 steps: confirm repo, AI setup, theme → generate Custom — Full 6-step wizard (repo, analysis, deploy, domain, sync, theme)
  • status — Shows current sync state, project info, and config summary.
  • sync — Runs incremental sync: git-diff → targeted re-analysis → rebuild.
  • undeploy — Removes a deployed documentation site from the hosting provider.
  • version-list — List available versions from git tags matching the configured pattern.
  • version-deploy — Deploy a specific version tag using mike.

items.title: summarizeModules async
items.text:
async function summarizeModules(
  options: SummarizeOptions
): Promise<SummarizeResult>

Run AI summarization on all modules.

Run AI summarization on all modules. Uses batched calls: one API request per module summarizes both the module and all its exported symbols. This reduces API call count from O(modules * symbols) to O(modules), which is more efficient regardless of backend. Fault-tolerant: - If the API key is missing, returns modules unchanged - If individual API calls fail, those summaries are skipped - Cached summaries are reused when content hasn't changed - Retry with backoff handles transient network errors

Parameters:

Name Type Default Description options SummarizeOptions

Returns: Promise<SummarizeResult>

items.title: context-builder.ts
items.text:
Smart Context Builder

Smart Context Builder Assembles ranked code chunks from the dependency graph for LLM calls. Provides most of RAG's benefits without embedding/vector dependencies. Relevance scoring uses the existing dependency graph: - Direct dependency: 1.0 - 1-hop transitive: 0.6 - Same directory: 0.4 - Same logical section: 0.3 - README/docs: 0.2

items.title: resolveApiKey
items.text:
function resolveApiKey(
  providerName: string,
  configuredEnvVar: string
): string | undefined

Resolve an API key for a provider using a priority chain:

Resolve an API key for a provider using a priority chain: 1. Explicit configured env var (configuredEnvVar) 2. Universal override (DOCWALK_AI_KEY), if not already the configured var 3. Well-known provider env vars (e.g. ANTHROPIC_API_KEY for anthropic) Returns undefined when no key is found.

Parameters:

Name Type Default Description providerName string configuredEnvVar string

Returns: string | undefined

items.text:
DocWalk Proxy AI Provider

DocWalk Proxy AI Provider Routes AI requests through DocWalk's free AI service (ai.docwalk.dev), backed by a self-hosted LiteLLM instance with local models. No API key required — uses a virtual key for free-tier usage tracking. Used as an automatic fallback when --ai is passed without any configured key.

items.title: engine.ts
items.text:
DocWalk Sync Engine

DocWalk Sync Engine Implements the git-diff based incremental sync strategy. Compares current HEAD against the last indexed commit SHA, identifies changed files, runs targeted re-analysis, and triggers incremental doc rebuild + deploy. Hardened to handle: corrupt state files, force pushes where the previous commit no longer exists, file renames, recursive impact analysis, and manual commit range diffing via --since.
